data.title: X-treme Parasail
data.meta_description: Are you looking for quick answers to questions about our company and tours? Visit this page to view a list of frequently asked guest questions, and get answers!
data.text:
Our company was established in 2003 by Greg Longnecker, a parasail expert with over 30 years of experience, and his family. Since then, X- Treme Parasail has grown into one the largest watersports companies on Oahu. As a family business, we stress the importance of values like integrity and hard work and strive to make every experience great.

Mornings are normally the best time to go. Weather and ocean conditions are generally nicer.

We provide 3 different parasail options, Standard (700 feet of line), Deluxe (850 feet of line) and X-Treme (1000 feet of line).

Yes! We recommend you wear your swim suit!

Riders must be at least 5 years old. We cannot fly you if you are pregnant, are susceptible to heart attacks, or are over 300 lbs.

Although we’re called X-Treme, parasailing is actually a peaceful activity.

Yes! We provide a photo service for a reasonable price. High-resolution photos of your flight are shot by our crew using DSLR cameras. You’ll be debriefed on the service once you board our boat—just make sure you let the crew know you want photos!

Parasailing will take around 1 hour, jet-skiing will take around 1 hour, and a combination of these activities will take around 3 hours including your own transportation. We ask that you check in 30 minutes before your scheduled activity. From check-in to your return to our booth, parasailing will take around 1.5 hours, jet-skiing will take around 1.5 hours, and a combination of these activities will take around 3 hours.

Our boats can carry up to 15 people according to U.S. Coast Guard regulations. For parties over 15 people, you will be split up into separate boats. Combination of parasail ride on a boat will be depends on weather condition and it is decided by captain and crew on a boat (We do not guarantee single rider or triple rider)

Tips are not required but they are definitely appreciated!

Recommend people who get seasick to take necessary precautions before the trip

You can bring whatever you want up there, however we are not responsible for any damage or loss that occurs to your items.
